Generate Cell-Type-Level Expression Heatmap

Source: R/customized_vis.R
heatmap_meta.Rd

This function creates a heatmap showing gene expression averaged across cell types or groups. Expression values are aggregated by taking the mean across all cells within each group, then optionally row-scaled (z-score normalized) for visualization. It allows for customization of gene label appearance.

heatmap_meta(
  object,
  features,
  groups,
  idents = NULL,
  bold_genes = NULL,
  row_fontsize = 10,
  normalize = TRUE,
  cluster_rows = FALSE,
  cluster_cols = FALSE,
  scale = "row",
  title = NA,
  angle_col = "315",
  file_name = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

object

A Seurat object containing expression data and metadata

features

Character vector of gene names to include in the heatmap

groups

Character vector specifying the order of cell type/group labels. This defines both which groups to include and their display order.

idents

Character string specifying the metadata column containing cell type or group information. If NULL, defaults to "cohort_tp".

bold_genes

Character vector of gene names to render in bold text. Uses bquote(bold(...)) for formatting. Default is NULL (no bolding).

row_fontsize

Numeric value specifying the font size for row labels (gene names). Default is 10.

normalize

Logical indicating whether to normalize the data before plotting. Default is TRUE.

cluster_rows

Logical indicating whether to cluster rows (genes). Default is FALSE.

cluster_cols

Logical indicating whether to cluster columns (groups). Default is FALSE.

scale

Character string indicating scaling method. Options are "row" (default), "column", or "none".

title

Optional character string for plot title. Default is NA (no title).

angle_col

Character string or numeric specifying the angle for column labels. Default is "315".

file_name

name of png file.

...

Additional arguments passed to pheatmap::pheatmap()

Value

A pheatmap object

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Optionally normalizes the Seurat object

  2. Extracts expression data for specified genes

  3. Averages expression across all cells within each group

  4. Orders groups according to the specified order

  5. Creates a heatmap with row scaling (z-score by default), applying bolding to specified gene names via labels_row and setting global font size via fontsize_row.

Row scaling computes z-scores as: $z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)$ where x represents expression values across all groups for a given gene.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic usage with bolded genes and larger font size
heatmap_meta(
object = object,
features = c("CD3D", "CD8A", "IFNG", "FOXP3"),
groups = c("CD4 T", "CD8 T", "NK"),
bold_genes = c("CD8A", "FOXP3"),
row_fontsize = 12
)

# With custom group column and no normalization
heatmap_meta(
object = object,
features = marker_genes,
groups = c("Chronic Pre-DAA", "ACTG Pre-DAA", "SR Pre-resolution"),
idents = "condition",
normalize = FALSE
)
} # }
